alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 3:12AM PST until December 29 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 15 to 19 feet. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding. * WHERE...San Francisco, Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore, San Francisco Peninsula Coast, Northern Monterey Bay and Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 PM PST this evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 2 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion will occur. Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
